title: Data ScienceFunctions

metadata.description: Learn about Data ScienceFunctions with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title:
Data Science
Functions

This chapter shows three commonly used functions when working 
with Data Science

The data set above consists of 6 variables, each with 10 observations:

content_sections.title: Duration
content_sections.content:
- How long lasted the training session in minutes?
Average_Pulse
- What was the average pulse of the training session? This is measured by beats per minute
Max_Pulse
- What was the max pulse of the training session?
Calorie_Burnage
- How much calories were burnt on the training session?
Hours_Work
- How many hours did we work at our job before the training session?
Hours_Sleep
- How much did we sleep the night before the training session?
We use underscore (_) to separate strings because Python cannot read space as separator.
The max() function
The Python
max()
function is used to find the highest value in an array.
Example
Average_pulse_max = max(80, 85, 90, 95, 100, 105, 110, 115, 120, 125)
print 
  (Average_pulse_max)

The min() function
The Python
min()
function is used to find the lowest value in an array.
Example
Average_pulse_min = min(80, 85, 90, 95, 100, 105, 110, 115, 120, 125)
print 
  (Average_pulse_min)

The mean() function
The NumPy
mean()
function is used to find the average value of an array.
Example
import numpy as np
Calorie_burnage = 
  [240, 250, 260, 270, 280, 290, 300, 310, 320, 330]
Average_calorie_burnage = 
  np.mean(Calorie_burnage)
print(Average_calorie_burnage)

Note:
We write
np.
in front of
mean
to let Python know that we want to activate the
mean
function from the
Numpy
library.

★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
import numpy as np
Calorie_burnage = 
  [240, 250, 260, 270, 280, 290, 300, 310, 320, 330]
Average_calorie_burnage = 
  np.mean(Calorie_burnage)
print(Average_calorie_burnage)

summary: This tutorial covers Data ScienceFunctions concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use Data ScienceFunctions effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of Data ScienceFunctions and how to apply it in your projects.
